title: [Large-scale] Medical Simulation-Based Technical Training: Conceptual-Procedural Integrated Teaching Methodology

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary Medical Terminology and Basic Patient Care Procedures
context.additional_context: Simulation-based training in a smartphone-centric limited technology environment, focusing on enhancing learners' practical application skills

learning_goals: Learners can replicate the lumbar puncture (LP) procedure with 80% accuracy in a simulation environment.
Learners can explain the anatomical and physiological rationale for each step in the lumbar puncture process.
Learners can apply knowledge acquired through simulation training to new clinical situations with over 70% accuracy.
Learners enhance teamwork and problem-solving skills through project-based collaborative activities.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
